snippet: Sales were tepid at both chains, causing executives to wonder when improvements in the economy and employment would become palpable in their stores.
abstract: J C Penney and Macy's report lackluster sales in the third quarter, latest sign that retailers cannot persuade shoppers to spend; J C Penney reports loss of 62 cents a share on sales of $2.76 billion in the third quarter, compared with loss of $1.94 a share on $2.78 billion for same period year earlier; Macy's reports total sales for quarter fell 1.3 percent, to $6.2 billion, compared with same period year earlier.

byline.original: By RACHEL ABRAMS and HIROKO TABUCHI

lead_paragraph: Sales were tepid at both chains, causing executives to wonder when improvements in the economy and employment would become palpable in their stores.

headline.main: J.C. Penney and Macy’s Post Lackluster Sales Before Holidays
headline.print_headline: J.C. Penney and Macy’s Post Lackluster Sales Before Holidays
